channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.description:

item.title: Report X-2024030759
item.description:
Report X-2024030759

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package came down the shoot in the load area wet. The package was put into an unlined tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: 1 X 12oz can of Enamel spray has a small hole on the bottom of it. The hole allowed 12oz of paint to leak out into the box is less then 5 minutes. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into an unlined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030902
item.description:
Report X-2024030902

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unmarked, wet pkg placed on top of bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose cap on 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle in manufacturer's packaging with Ltd Qty diamond printed on packaging allowed liquid to leak wetting the contents, inner packaging, and carton causing the inner and outer cartons to partially dissolve. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed on top of bin.

item.title: Report X-2024030707
item.description:
Report X-2024030707

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package got wet from the rain. Fiberboard was already weak from being reused twice already. Bottom of box gave out from being wet causing one of the contents to break. DescribePack: body pf bottle broke DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a leaking bin.

item.title: Report X-2024030901
item.description:
Report X-2024030901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle has a 1 1/2" split in the side near the bottom caused by the pkg being dropped and the force of the impact hitting the floor causing the damage. Liquid leaked wetting and contaminating the contents, carton, cleanup material and Hazmat bin liner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in Hazmat bin.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING UPON UNLOADING OUT OF THE TRAILER. WHEN RESPONDED TO AND OPENED THERE WAS MULTIPLE UNDECLARED AEROSOLS FOUND INSIDE THE PACKAGE. ONE HAD THE CAP COMPLETELY OFF AND WAS EMPTY FROM THE PACKING MATERIAL PRESSING ON THE SPRAY NOZZLE.

item.title: Report I-2023120009
item.description:
Report I-2023120009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: BRANFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HOP ENERGY LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Technician arrive on site for No Heat at a brand new customers home. Tech found oil leaking from old oil tank, A new tank has since been installed. The old oil tank in in a crawl space below the home and has a slow active leak. The homeowner is aware and seeking assistance from the State of Ct.
